Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below with part of two added red bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander frieze at rim above band of blanks filled with squares; below, painted decoration consisting of part of neck, ear and eye of bull to right.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd is in the Mature Animal Style. Whilst bulls feature on both Wild Goat Style and Mature Animal Style vessels, the lack of interior decoration is typical of the Wild Goat Style, therefore the sherd is likely to be earlier.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 262, no. 531)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0117) (phase 2)
